result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Anthony Cook

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant James Anthony Cook appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke appeared by video for James Anthony Cook.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 36, Judge Crivello. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading; incorrect date in original information. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 36. Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Anthony Cook in court in person.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel does not appear and did not make contact with the court. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 9/7/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant James Anthony Cook in court.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for James Anthony Cook. Student Intern Abigail Doweiko under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Tom Potter who is available by phone.Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant failed to report for booking process.  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Court reinstates previously forfeited bail. Case adjourned, Br. PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Anthony Cook appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing in error. Defendant is in warrant status. Court orders defense to contact Out Of Custody Court to clear the Warrant and be given a new court date.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant James Anthony Cook not in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Defendant failed to be booked and released by August 19th, 2022 by 5:00pm. Court ordered signature bond forfeited.

Oral No Contact Order with BAH.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/19/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant James Anthony Cook in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/17/22 @ 2:30p
